intro: Pavonia opulifolia, commonly known as the scarlet bower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant red or pink flowers that bloom in summer. The plant features palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soil. Pavonia opulifolia is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
